headline.main: STALINGRAD ARMY IN VICTORY MARCH; Chuikoff, Its Commander, and 38-Year-Old Rokassovsky Review Parade of Heroes SURRENDERS DEFY HITLER Gen. von Drebber Reveals That Recommendation for End of Resistance Was Rejected

lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, Feb. 1 -- The capture of Field Marshal General Friedrich von Paulus and many other generals of the German Sixth Army and Fourth Tank Group on the seventieth day of their encirclement at Stalingrad was celebrated today when 38-year-old Col. Gen. Constantine Rokassovsky, who began the war as a colonel, and Lieut. Gen. Vassily Ivanovitch Chulkoff, commander of the heroic Seventy-second Army, took the salute as their armies paraded.
abstract: Maj Gen M von Drebber surrender described
